intro: Anerincleistus collinus, commonly known as the golden cup fern, is a tropical plant belonging to the family Polypodiaceae. It is characterized by its compact, rosette-like growth habit and is native to regions of Southeast Asia. The plant features delicate, bright yellow to golden-green fronds that are often covered in fine, silky hairs. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found growing on tree trunks or rocks. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated as a decorative plant in tropical gardens and greenhouses.
